concept.title: Plugin configuration
concept.shortdesc: If you feel the IBMÂ® RMF for z/OS Grafana plugin consumes too much memory after plotting charts and reports or working with time-series data, you can configure it to optimize its performance.

conbody.p: You can modify the ../datasources/rmf-plugin-config.yaml file by changing the cache settings to ensure that the RMF for z/OS plugin is working efficiently and not taking up excessive memory. You must restart the Docker container once the configuration is modified.
The following table describes the logging and cache settings in the configuration file:

row.entry: This parameter logs the errors in the Grafana log file; however, these logs do not include request and response information.

This parameter logs all errors in the Grafana log file and includes information about the request and response, if applicable.
You can change the value to true to include request and response details and provide a more comprehensive and informative log for better analysis and resolution.
This parameter specifies the size of the metrics cache for the plugin.
This parameter specifies the size of the cache (in MB) used to store request information for streaming timeline data.

Usually, the default size is sufficient for the pre-defined dashboards, and you need to change it only if additional user-defined dashboards and timeline panels are specified in your organization that uses the RMF for z/OS plugin.
This parameter specifies the size of the cache (in MB) used to store the data interval and time offset for streaming timeline data.
